commitResults.messageTitle: We now only have a very skeleton of the Duke class.
commitResults.messageBody:
This needs to be changed to be able to utilise good software engineering principles by creating new classes

Extracting out common behaviours into a separate method & creating new classes for abstraction allows us to employ good swe principles

Let's edit Duke class & create new quote class (Additional random feature)

Duke class:
* Employed abstraction principles for print methods so that changes can be easily made
* Instantiated new Quote class which generates a Quote of the Day
* Utilise Scanner to get user input

Quote class: Abstracted out the generation of quotes to a separate class
* Utilise Arraylist and random number generator to randomly generate a quote

commitResults.messageTitle: Add some characteristics to duke, our motivator!
Add functionality to store and display user tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Right now, we perform all commands through Duke's main method. This can be abstracted out into another method for simplicity.

Lets abstract this code out into a method performCommand which performs the user task! This method will call the necessary functions within the Duke class from now on.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add a Task class which is able to keep track of its done status. Created toString representation for easy printing
commitResults.messageBody: Expand performCommand method to cater to instances of "mark" & "unmark"

commitResults.messageTitle: Add functionality for 3 types of tasks - Todo, Deadline and Events
commitResults.messageBody:
All 3 tasks inherits from the Task class which allows us to add features unique to each task while utilising working features
Utilise Regex for matching to extract out the users' intention for their input
Remove code which generates random quote of the day in order to facilitate stable testing

commitResults.messageTitle: Error Handling through creation of DukeException class
commitResults.messageBody: Explanations for each error provided in code

Make use of arraylist to delete Tasks easily

Previously, we throw individual exceptions based on the result of checkValidTask.
Lets move throwing of invalid task errors to checkValidTask in order to abstract it out from the other methods.
Lets make checking of valid task more robust by checking if provided value < 1
